question: A friend of yours is thinking of going on a camping holiday for the first time this summer. He/she has asked for your advice.Write a letter to your friend. In your letter:* explain why you think your friend would enjoy a camping holiday* describe some possible disadvantages* say whether you would like to go camping with your friend this summer
text: I hope you are doing well. I am writing a letter to provide you an important information since you are planning to go first time on a camping holiday this summer.

I am very much confident that you will really enjoy the camping holiday. Firstly, the location is extremely beautiful, clean and safe. Fortunately, it is very close to river which will definitely give you nice surrounding and you will enjoy nature. There are so many facilities at the site, therefore, you will not face any difficulties.

However, I would like to mention some drawbacks as well. The area is having telephone network issues. Thus, you will not be able to contact someone. For that, you need to go nearby town. Furthermore, you have to be careful about insects which will harm you during night time. Nevertheless, you may use spray to avoid it.

I wanted to join with you. Unfortunately, I am having practical exams for last semester of my engineering couse. As a result, I would not be able to go with you for it. No worries, we may plan again in future and enjoy it
Please take care and give my regards to your family members.

error_list.error_des: It appears that you are missing a preposition with the verb provide. Consider adding the preposition.
The word an doesn’t seem to fit this context. Consider replacing it with a different one.
The noun phrase river seems to be missing a determiner before it. Consider adding an article.
It seems that surrounding may not agree in number with other words in this phrase.
The word night time seems to be miswritten. Consider replacing it.
The noun phrase spray seems to be missing a determiner before it. Consider adding an article.
It seems that preposition use may be incorrect here.
It seems that there is an article usage problem here.
